page.title: 01THE DUNSMORE AREA
page.content: The Chiltern Ridge, South of the Icknield Way, between Wendover and Ellesbrough is a sparsely populated area on the edge of the north escarpment of th Chiltern Hills with chalk uplands rising to 800ft, capped by gault and divided by deep, dry valleys, running north/south. The whole area is criss_crossed by public footpaths, including the Ridgeway and much used by hikers. The Northern and Western parts largely belong to the National Trust or the Trustees of the Chequers' Estate. The only population is Dunsmore, a hamlet of approximately 90 inhabitants, which has to use all the amenities of Wendover 4kms away. The eastern edge of the grid is traversed north/south by the A413 from Amersham to Aylesbury and the railway from Marylebone to Aylesbury.
